Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Hemolysis During Bed Rest and Nutritional Intervention

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomized to receive either a control diet or a diet supplemented with polyphenols, omega-3, vitamin E, and selenium.

Participants.evidence: 20 male participants, aged 20-45 years, with a BMI of 22-27 kg/m², at the MEDES space clinic in France.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomized to receive either a control diet or a diet supplemented with polyphenols, omega-3, vitamin E, and selenium.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate hemolysis during 60 days of bed rest and the impact of a nutritional intervention.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was endogenous carbon monoxide (CO) elimination, measured by gas chromatography over 60 days.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Result_Outcome.evidence: CO elimination increased significantly after 5, 11, 30, and 57 days of bed rest compared to baseline: +289 ppb (95% CI 101–477 ppb; p = 0.004), +253 ppb (78–427 ppb; p = 0.007), +193 ppb (89–298 ppb; p = 0.001), and +858 ppb (670–1046 ppb; p < 0.000), respectively.

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by the Center National d’Etudes Spatiales and the European Space Agency.
